TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit CngKeyCreationParameters extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Contains advanced properties for key creation.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CngKey> objects contain properties. Some properties must be added to a key when it is created. Other properties can be added after the key is created.
The <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CngKeyCreationParameters> class enables you to add properties to a key as it is being created. You can do this by passing a <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CngKeyCreationParameters> object that contains standard key properties, such as key storage provider (KSP), export policy, key usage, user interface (UI) policy, and parent window handle, to the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CngKey.Create%2A> method. The <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CngKey> object that is being created will be initialized with these values before it is finalized.
You can also add non-standard properties to a key by using the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CngKeyCreationParameters.Parameters%2A> property.
If you need to add properties after a key is created, use the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CngKey.SetProperty%2A> method.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
Gets or sets the key export policy.
Docs.value: An object that specifies a key export policy. The default value is , which indicates that the key storage provider's default export policy is set.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For information about key export policies, see the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CngExportPolicies> class.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the key creation options.
Docs.value: An object that specifies options for creating keys. The default value is , which indicates that the key storage provider's default key creation options are set.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The returned <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CngKeyCreationOptions> object defines options that are used when you create a new <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CngKey> object. These options determine whether the key is created in the user or machine key store, and whether a new key should overwrite an existing key. By default, if <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CngKeyCreationOptions?displayProperty=fullName> is not specified, the key is created in the user store.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the cryptographic operations that apply to the current key.
Docs.value: A bitwise combination of one or more enumeration values that specify key usage. The default value is , which indicates that the key storage provider's default key usage is set.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property is used when you create a new <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CngKey> object. It specifies the usages (such as encryption/decryption, signing/verification, and secret agreement generation) that will be enabled on the new key.

Docs.summary: Enables a object to be created with additional properties that are set before the key is finalized.
Docs.value: A collection object that contains any additional parameters that you must set on a object during key creation.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CngKeyCreationParameters> class enables you to create a new <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CngKey> object and initialize it with common properties. If you must set additional properties on the key during its creation, follow these steps:
1. Create a new <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CngProperty> object for each additional property that you must set.
2. Call the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CngKeyCreationParameters.Parameters%2A> property to obtain an empty <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CngPropertyCollection> object.
3. Add the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CngProperty> objects to the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CngPropertyCollection> object.
4. Call the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CngKey.Create%28System.Security.Cryptography.CngAlgorithm%2CSystem.String%2CSystem.Security.Cryptography.CngKeyCreationParameters%29> method overload and pass the initialized <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CngKeyCreationParameters> object to it.

Docs.permission: for operating with unmanaged code. Demand value: . Associated enumeration:

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the window handle that should be used as the parent window for dialog boxes that are created by Cryptography Next Generation (CNG) classes.
Docs.value: The HWND of the parent window that is used for CNG dialog boxes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property should be set if key creation causes CNG to show a dialog box.

Docs.permission: for operating with unmanaged code. Demand value: . Associated enumeration:

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the key storage provider (KSP) to create a key in.
Docs.value: An object that specifies the KSP that a new key will be created in.
Docs.exception: The property is set to a value.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets information about the user interface to display when a key is created or accessed.
Docs.value: An object that contains details about the user interface shown by Cryptography Next Generation (CNG) classes when a key is created or accessed. A value indicates that the key storage provider's default user interface policy is set.
